skill.name: temporal-python-testing
skill.description: Test Temporal workflows with pytest, time-skipping, and mocking strategies. Covers unit testing, integration testing, replay testing, and local development setup. Use when implementing Temporal workflow tests or debugging test failures.
skill.summary: Test Temporal workflows with pytest, time-skipping, and mocking strategies. Covers unit testing, int...

security_audit.summary: No credential access, exfiltration, or execution of untrusted payloads found. Content is instructional and matches the stated testing purpose.

content.value_statement: Temporal workflow tests can be slow or flaky. This skill shows fast, deterministic testing with time skipping, mocking, and replay checks.
actual_capabilities: Explain unit testing with WorkflowEnvironment time skipping
Show activity testing patterns with ActivityEnvironment
Describe integration testing with mocked activities and error injection
Guide replay testing for determinism and version compatibility
Outline local setup with Docker Compose and pytest configuration
limitations: Does not run tests or access your Temporal server
Examples are templates and require your project code
Replay testing requires existing workflow histories
Coverage targets are recommendations, not guarantees

use_cases.title: Add fast unit tests
use_cases.description: Create quick workflow and activity tests with time skipping.

use_cases.title: Validate integration flows
use_cases.description: Mock external services and verify workflow orchestration paths.

use_cases.title: Run replay checks
use_cases.description: Confirm workflow determinism before deploying changes.

prompt_templates.title: Start unit tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal pytest setup to test a workflow with time skipping and a simple activity.

prompt_templates.title: Mock activities
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an integration test example that mocks activities and verifies workflow branching.

prompt_templates.title: Replay safety check
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to replay workflow histories and detect non deterministic changes.

prompt_templates.title: CI coverage plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a CI plan with pytest markers, coverage thresholds, and replay tests.

output_examples.input: Create a test plan for Temporal workflows with unit, integration, and replay coverage.
output: Use time skipping for unit workflow tests and ActivityEnvironment for isolated activities
Mock external activities in integration tests and cover error paths
Replay a set of production histories before deployment to confirm determinism

best_practices: Use time skipping for all workflow unit tests
Mock external dependencies in integration tests
Run replay tests before deploying workflow changes
anti_patterns: Calling real external APIs inside workflow tests
Using random or datetime in workflow code without Temporal helpers
Skipping replay tests after significant workflow refactors

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: Examples target Python 3.10 or newer with the Temporal Python SDK.

faq.question: Are there limits on test size?
faq.answer: No fixed limits, but large replay suites should be batched in CI.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing pytest setups?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance uses standard pytest fixtures and markers.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance only and does not read files or secrets.

faq.question: What if tests fail due to nondeterminism?
faq.answer: Use workflow.get_version and avoid random or datetime without Temporal helpers.

faq.question: How does this compare to end to end tests?
faq.answer: It emphasizes faster unit and integration tests, with replay for safety.
